actor_awards.notes: Nominated for the Academy Award five times without winning. Won Golden Globes for 'Scrooge', 'The Gathering Storm', and as New Star of the Year (1961). Declined a knighthood in 2000.

filmography.title: Tom Jones
filmography.role_description: A charming, rascally foundling in 18th-century England who embarks on a series of amorous and raucous adventures.
filmography.plot: A foundling raised by a wealthy squire rises to prominence and fortune through his popularity with women, despite the machinations of his jealous cousin.

filmography.title: Saturday Night and Sunday Morning
filmography.role_description: An angry, rebellious young factory worker in Nottingham who spends his wages on drinking and women.
filmography.plot: A rebellious factory worker tries to escape the drudgery of his life through drink and affairs, but finds himself trapped by the consequences of his actions.
filmography.awards: BAFTA Film Award: Win – Most Promising Newcomer to Leading Film Roles

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: The brilliant, eccentric Belgian detective who must solve a murder on a snowbound train filled with suspects.
filmography.plot: Renowned detective Hercule Poirot investigates the murder of a wealthy American businessman aboard the famous train.

filmography.title: The Dresser
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical, aging Shakespearean actor who struggles to perform 'King Lear' during the Blitz.
filmography.plot: A personal assistant struggles to get a deteriorating veteran actor through a difficult performance of King Lear.

filmography.title: Under the Volcano
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic former British consul in Mexico living out the last day of his life on the Day of the Dead.
filmography.plot: Against a background of war breaking out in Europe and the Mexican fiesta Day of the Dead, an alcoholic ex-consul descends into self-destruction.

filmography.title: Erin Brockovich
filmography.role_description: A weary but principled lawyer who hires the title character and helps her take on a massive energy corporation.
filmography.plot: An unemployed single mother becomes a legal assistant and almost single-handedly brings down a California power company accused of polluting a city's water supply.

filmography.title: Big Fish
filmography.role_description: A dying father known for telling tall tales, whose son tries to find the truth behind the stories.
filmography.plot: A frustrated son tries to determine the fact from fiction in his dying father's life.

filmography.title: Miller's Crossing
filmography.role_description: An Irish political boss who controls a Prohibition-era city, facing a war with a rival Italian gang.
filmography.plot: Tom Reagan, an advisor to a Prohibition-era crime boss, tries to keep the peace between warring mobs but gets caught in the middle.

filmography.title: Scrooge
filmography.role_description: The miserly Victorian businessman who is visited by three spirits on Christmas Eve in this musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: A musical retelling of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an old bitter miser taken on a journey of self-redemption.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: The Gathering Storm
filmography.role_description: Portrays Churchill during his 'wilderness years' leading up to World War II, battling political irrelevance and depression. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A biographical look at Winston Churchill in the years leading up to World War II, as he attempts to warn Britain of the Nazi threat.
filmography.awards: Emmy: Win – Outstanding Lead Actor in a Miniseries or a Movie

filmography.title: Before the Devil Knows You're Dead
filmography.role_description: The father of two brothers who rob his jewelry store, leading to tragic consequences.
filmography.plot: When two brothers organize the robbery of their parents' jewelry store, the job goes horribly wrong, triggering a series of events that sends them, their father, and one brother's wife hurtling towards a shattering climax.
filmography.awards: Gotham Award: Nomination – Best Ensemble Cast

filmography.title: Shoot the Moon
filmography.role_description: A successful writer whose marriage collapses, leading to a bitter custody battle.
filmography.plot: A husband and wife deal with the devastating effects of their disintegrating marriage on themselves and their four children.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama

filmography.title: Annie
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, gruff industrialist who opens his home to the orphan Annie.
filmography.plot: A young orphan girl's adventures in finding a family that will take her.

filmography.title: Skyfall
filmography.role_description: The gamekeeper of the Bond family estate in Scotland who helps James Bond defend his home.
filmography.plot: James Bond's loyalty to M is tested when her past comes back to haunt her. When MI6 comes under attack, 007 must track down and destroy the threat, no matter how personal the cost.

filmography.title: Traffic
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking government official dealing with the complexities of the drug war.
filmography.plot: A conservative judge is appointed by the President to spearhead America's escalating war against drugs, only to discover that his teenage daughter is a crack addict.
filmography.awards: SAG Award: Win – Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture

filmography.title: Two for the Road
filmography.role_description: An architect who reflects on his twelve-year relationship with his wife during a road trip.
filmography.plot: A couple in the south of France non-sequentially spin down the highways of infidelity in their troubled ten-year marriage.

filmography.title: The Browning Version
filmography.role_description: A disliked, rigid schoolmaster who is forced into retirement and confronts the failure of his life.
filmography.plot: A teacher who is forced to retire from a public school reflects on his life and career, realizing he is despised by his pupils and staff.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or (Film)

filmography.title: Gumshoe
filmography.role_description: A bingo caller who dreams of being a private eye and gets caught up in a real mystery.
filmography.plot: A bingo-caller and aspiring private eye is drawn into a web of murder and drugs.

filmography.title: A Man of No Importance
filmography.role_description: A closeted gay bus conductor in 1960s Dublin who stages a production of Oscar Wilde's 'Salome'.
filmography.plot: A Dublin bus conductor attempts to produce a play in his local church hall, but faces opposition due to the play's content.

filmography.title: Washington Square
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and controlling father who disapproves of his shy daughter's suitor.
filmography.plot: A lonely, plain young woman stands to inherit a fortune from her father, but he believes her suitor is only after the money.

filmography.title: Wolfen
filmography.role_description: A detective investigating a series of gruesome murders in New York City.
filmography.plot: A city cop is assigned to solve a bizarre set of violent murders where the victims look as if they have been killed by animals.

filmography.title: Orphans
filmography.role_description: A mobster who is kidnapped by two brothers but turns the tables and becomes a father figure to them.
filmography.plot: Two brothers living in a dilapidated house kidnap a drunken man, unaware that he is a powerful gangster.

filmography.title: Corpse Bride
filmography.role_description: The voice of the stuffy and status-obsessed father of the bride in this stop-motion animated film.
filmography.plot: When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her.

filmography.title: Amazing Grace
filmography.role_description: The former slave ship captain turned clergyman and abolitionist who wrote the hymn 'Amazing Grace'.
filmography.plot: The idealist William Wilberforce maneuvers his way through Parliament, endeavoring to end the British transatlantic slave trade.

filmography.title: The Duellists
filmography.role_description: The Minister of Police who oversees the ongoing conflict between two officers.
filmography.plot: The obsessive, decades-long duel between two officers in Napoleon's army.

filmography.title: Charlie Bubbles
filmography.role_description: A successful writer who feels alienated from his life and returns to his hometown. Finney also directed this film.
filmography.plot: A writer, bored with his success and wealth, returns to his hometown in the north of England to find his roots.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or (Film)
